taxon_name.authority: (M. E. Jones) H. M. Hall & Clements

bio:treatment.description: Plants 20–60 cm. Leaves moderately crowded, green; blades 1-nerved, linear, 20–40 × ca. 1 mm, faces glabrous or sparsely hairy, eglandular, somewhat viscid; distalmost shorter than arrays. Heads 5–10 in compact, racemiform arrays. Involucres 11–12.5 mm. Phyllaries 13–22, apices erect, attenuate. Florets 5–7; corollas clear yellow, 10–11 mm, tubes glabrous, throats gradually dilated, lobes 1.5–2 mm. 2n = 18.
Mountain slopes, dry, stony soils, sagebrush, pinyon-juniper, ponderosa pine, and aspen communities;
bio:treatment.discussion: S. L. Welsh et al. (1987) noted that characteristics used to distinguish var. howardii from var. attenuata (distalmost leaves overtopping arrays and pale-colored florets) fail as diagnostic features for plants from Utah.
